title: 114_hr108
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so we will summarize the curr_chunk as follows:

"AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM." "AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8335a terminates retirement coverage of Members of Congress, no further contributions or deductions allowed." The curr_chunk discusses the deposit of funds in the Treasury of the United States to the credit of the Fund, without affecting prior rights or the eligibility of Members to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The curr_chunk discusses regulations for matters relating to the Thrift Savings Plan, to be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections of chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress and amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System are discussed. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress is addressed by inserting a new section in the United States Code. This section states that Members who first join before a specific date will no longer be subject to retirement coverage after a certain period or after completing 5 years of service. Members of Congress who first join before a specific date will no longer be subject to retirement coverage after completing 5 years of service. After ceasing to be subject to this chapter, no further Government contributions or deductions from basic pay may be made. For those who first become a Member on or after the specified date, they will not be subject to this chapter, and no Government contributions or deductions from basic pay will be made for deposit in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Members of Congress who first join before a specific date will no longer be subject to retirement coverage after completing 5 years of service. After ceasing to be subject to this chapter, no further Government contributions or deductions from basic pay may be made. This does not affect any prior rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter. Participation in the Thrift Savings Plan is also unaffected. Regulations for implementation may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management may prescribe regulations for implementing retirement coverage changes for Members of Congress. The Executive Director will handle matters related to the Thrift Savings Plan. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
